findings.title: Rewrite these statements using constant-time operations.
findings.description: The finding suggests rewriting certain statements to use constant-time operations instead of variable-time ones.

findings.title: Incorporating Fuzzing into Continuous Integration Process
findings.description: Consider incorporating fuzzing into your continuous integration process to help reveal similar bugs in the future.

findings.title: Ingest and view servers should be run under distinct users
findings.description: The ingest and view servers should be run using distinct operating system and database users to help distinguish their actions.

findings.title: Consider Incorporating Rust Bindings for Libsodium
findings.description: Incorporating one of the Rust bindings for libsodium into the codebase could provide additional security features such as zeroing memory that is no longer in use, surrounding protected memory with guard pages, and preventing it from being paged to the swap area.

findings.title: Potential Issues with > Operator
findings.description: Consider performing a deeper analysis to determine whether using the > operator will be problematic in practice.

findings.title: Insufficient Domain Separation in Key Exchange PRF Function
findings.description: In future versions of the key exchange prf function, insufficient domain separation between inputs can cause collisions to occur even when the inputs actually differ.

findings.title: Incorporating Instruction Trace Analysis
findings.description: Consider incorporating instruction trace analysis into continuous integration process to ensure constant-time behavior of certain functions

findings.title: Sensitive Information Leakage through debug_assert Statements
findings.description: The debug_assert statements leak sensitive information and should never run in production.

findings.title: Bias Introduction through Result Manipulation
findings.description: Adding one to the second result introduces a bias, making its distribution non-uniform and correlated with the first result.

findings.title: Multiplication Overflow in compute_mem_kb
findings.description: The `compute_mem_kb` function is vulnerable to multiplication overflow, which can cause allocation size issues.

findings.title: Two recommendations:
findings.description: Long term, consider performing a deeper analysis to determine whether using the operator will be problematic in practice.

findings.title: Unprotected Sensitive Data Structures
findings.description: Sensitive data can remain in memory even after the memory has been freed, resulting in unintended exposure. Using zeroize to protect all data structures containing sensitive data reduces this risk.

findings.title: Insecure Greater-Than Comparison
findings.description: Using the `>` operator for comparison may be optimized into a branch, violating constant-time property, similar to how the subtle crate performs comparisons.
